00020 /** \file
00021  \brief serial stuff
00022  */
00023 
00024 // Code and ideas borrowed in places from
00025 // http://easysw.com/~mike/serial/serial.html
00026 
00027 #include "obdserial.h"
00028 
00029 #include <stdio.h>
00030 #include <string.h>
00031 #include <unistd.h>
00032 #include <fcntl.h>
00033 #include <errno.h>
00034 #include <time.h>
00035 #include <sys/time.h>
00036 #include <termios.h>
00037 
00038 /// What to use as the obd newline char in commands
00039 #define OBDCMD_NEWLINE "\r"
00040 
00041 /// Whether serial data is into pc, or out from pc
00042 #define SERIAL_IN 0
00043 #define SERIAL_OUT 1
00044 
00045 /// Handle to the serial log
00046 static FILE *seriallog = NULL;
00047 
00048 /// Guess the baudrate
00049 /** return -1 on error, or baudrate on success */
00050 static long guessbaudrate(int fd);
00051 
00052 /// Upgrade the baudrate
00053 /** \param baudrate_target 0 to guess, -1 to disable, specified number for >0
00054   \return -1 on error, or baudrate on success */
00055 static long upgradebaudrate(int fd, long baudrate_target, long current_baudrate);
00056 
00057 /// Write to the log
00058 static void appendseriallog(const char *line, int out) {
00059     if(NULL != seriallog) {
00060         char timestr[200];
00061         time_t t;
00062         struct tm *tmp;
00063 
00064         t = time(NULL);
00065         tmp = localtime(&t);
00066         if (tmp == NULL) {
00067             snprintf(timestr, sizeof(timestr), "Unknown time");
00068         }
00069 
00070         if (strftime(timestr, sizeof(timestr), "%H:%M:%S", tmp) == 0) {
00071             snprintf(timestr, sizeof(timestr), "Unknown time");
00072         }
00073 
00074         fprintf(seriallog, "%s(%s): '%s'\n", timestr, out==SERIAL_OUT?"out":"in", line);
00075         fflush(seriallog);
00076     }
00077 }
00078 
00079 /// Collect data up to the next prompt
00080 /** Reads up to the next '>'
00081    \param buf buffer to fill
00082    \param n size of buf
00083    \return number of bytes put in buf, or -1 on error
00084 */
00085 int readserialdata(int fd, char *buf, int n) {
00086     char *bufptr = buf; // current position in buf
00087 
00088     struct timeval start,curr; // For timing out
00089     if(0 != gettimeofday(&start, NULL)) {
00090         perror("Couldn't gettimeofday");
00091         return -1;
00092     }
00093     memset((void *)buf, '\0', n);
00094     int retval = 0; // Value to return
00095     int nbytes; // Number of bytes read
00096     do {
00097         nbytes = read(fd, bufptr, buf+n-bufptr-1);
00098         if(-1 == nbytes && EAGAIN != errno) {
00099             perror("Error in readserialdata");
00100         }
00101         if(-1 != nbytes) {
00102             // printf("Read bytes '%s'\n", bufptr);
00103             retval += nbytes; // Increment bytecount
00104             bufptr += nbytes; // Move pointer forward
00105         }
00106         if(0 != gettimeofday(&curr, NULL)) {
00107             perror("Couldn't gettimeofday");
00108             return -1;
00109         }
00110         if(OBDCOMM_TIMEOUT < 1000000l*(curr.tv_sec - start.tv_sec) +
00111             (curr.tv_usec - start.tv_usec)) {
00112             printf("Timeout!\n");
00113             return -1;
00114         }
00115     } while (retval == 0 || bufptr[-1] != '>');
00116 
00117     appendseriallog(buf, SERIAL_IN);
00118     return retval;
00119 }
00120 
00121 /// Throw away all data until the next prompt
00122 void readtonextprompt(int fd) {
00123     char retbuf[4096]; // Buffer to store returned stuff
00124     readserialdata(fd, retbuf, sizeof(retbuf));
00125 }
00126 
00127 // Blindly send a command and throw away all data to next prompt
00128 /**
00129  \param cmd command to send
00130  \param no_response if we don't read to next prompt [ie, on exit]
00131  \param fd file descriptor
00132  */
00133 void blindcmd(int fd, const char *cmd, int no_response) {
00134     char outstr[1024];
00135     snprintf(outstr, sizeof(outstr), "%s%s\0", cmd, OBDCMD_NEWLINE);
00136     appendseriallog(outstr, SERIAL_OUT);
00137     write(fd,outstr, strlen(outstr));
00138     if(0 != no_response) {
00139         sleep(1);
00140         readtonextprompt(fd);
00141     }
00142 }
00143 
00144 int openserial(const char *portfilename, long baudrate, long baudrate_target) {
00145     struct termios options;
00146     int fd;
00147 
00148     fprintf(stderr,"Opening serial port %s, this can take a while\n", portfilename);
00149     fd = open(portfilename, O_RDWR | O_NOCTTY | O_NDELAY);
00150     // fd = open(portfilename, O_RDWR | O_NOCTTY);
00151 
00152     if(fd == -1) {
00153         perror(portfilename);
00154     } else {
00155         fcntl(fd, F_SETFL, 0);
00156 
00157         // Get the current options for the port
00158         tcgetattr(fd, &options);
00159 
00160         options.c_cflag |= (CLOCAL | CREAD);
00161         options.c_lflag &= !(ICANON | ECHO | ECHOE | ISIG);
00162         options.c_oflag &= !(OPOST);
00163         options.c_cc[VMIN] = 0;
00164         options.c_cc[VTIME] = 100;
00165 
00166         tcsetattr(fd, TCSANOW, &options);
00167 
00168         long current_baud = 9600;
00169         if(0 != modifybaud(fd, baudrate)) {
00170             fprintf(stderr, "Error modifying baudrate. Continuing, but may suffer issues\n");
00171         } else {
00172             if(baudrate != 0)
00173                 current_baud = baudrate;
00174         }
00175 
00176         // Reset the device. Some software changes settings and then leaves it
00177         blindcmd(fd,"ATZ",1);
00178 
00179         // printf("Baudrate upgrader disabled\n");
00180         if(0 > upgradebaudrate(fd, baudrate_target, current_baud)) {
00181             fprintf(stderr, "Error upgrading baudrate. Continuing, but may suffer issues\n");
00182         }
00183 
00184         // Now some churn to get everything up and running.
00185         // Do a general cmd that all obd-devices support
00186         // Do this once in case we have a partially-written command somehow
00187         blindcmd(fd,"0100",1);
00188         // Disable command echo [elm327]
00189         blindcmd(fd,"ATE0",1);
00190         // Disable linefeeds [an extra byte of speed can't hurt]
00191         blindcmd(fd,"ATL0",1);
00192         // Don't insert spaces [readability is for ugly bags of mostly water]
00193         blindcmd(fd,"ATS0",1);
00194         // Then do it again to make sure the command really worked
00195         blindcmd(fd,"0100",1);
00196 
00197     }
00198     return fd;
00199 }
00200 
00201 void closeserial(int fd) {
00202     blindcmd(fd,"ATZ",0);
00203     close(fd);
00204 }
00205 
00206 static long attempt_upgradebaudrate(int fd, long rate, long previousrate) {
00207     char brd_cmd[64];
00208 
00209     int timeout = 500; // this many ms
00210     int brt_val = timeout / 5; // ATBRT wants it in increments of five ms
00211     char brt_cmd[64];
00212     snprintf(brt_cmd, sizeof(brt_cmd), "ATBRT%02X", brt_val);
00213 
00214     blindcmd(fd, brt_cmd, 1);
00215     // printf("%s\n", brt_cmd);
00216     
00217     int brd_val = 4000000l/rate;
00218     snprintf(brd_cmd, sizeof(brd_cmd), "ATBRD%02X" OBDCMD_NEWLINE, brd_val);
00219     printf("%li [%02X]:", rate, brd_val);
00220 
00221     int nbytes = write(fd, brd_cmd, strlen(brd_cmd));
00222     if(-1 == nbytes) {
00223         printf("\n");
00224         perror("Error writing to serial port upgrading baudrate");
00225         return -1;
00226     }
00227     
00228     char elm_response[64];
00229     memset(elm_response, '\0', sizeof(elm_response));
00230     int readcount = 0;
00231     while(NULL == strstr(elm_response, "?") && NULL == strstr(elm_response, "OK")) {
00232         nbytes = read(fd, elm_response+readcount, sizeof(elm_response)-readcount);
00233         // printf("Read \"%s\", %i\n", elm_response, readcount);
00234         if(-1 == nbytes && errno != EAGAIN) {
00235             printf("\n");
00236             perror("Error reading[1] from serial port upgrading baudrate");
00237             return -1;
00238         }
00239         if(-1 != nbytes) {
00240             readcount += nbytes;
00241         }
00242     }
00243 
00244     // printf("\nreadcount: %i: \"%s\"\n", readcount, elm_response);
00245     if(NULL != strstr(elm_response, "OK")) {
00246         // printf("got OK");
00247         if(-1 == modifybaud(fd,rate)) {
00248             printf("Error modifying baudrate to %li\n", rate);
00249             return -1;
00250         }
00251         
00252         char elm_response2[256];
00253         memset(elm_response2, '\0', sizeof(elm_response2));
00254 
00255 //      usleep(timeout * 1000); // Give it a chance to upgrade
00256 
00257         struct timeval start,end;
00258         gettimeofday(&start, NULL);
00259 
00260         int readcount2 = 0;
00261         while(readcount2 < 5 && NULL == strstr(elm_response2,">")) {
00262             nbytes = read(fd, elm_response2 + readcount2, sizeof(elm_response2)-readcount2);
00263 
00264             if(-1 == nbytes && EAGAIN != errno) {
00265                 perror("Error reading[2] from serial port upgrading baudrate");
00266                 modifybaud(fd,previousrate);
00267                 return -1;
00268             }
00269 
00270             gettimeofday(&end, NULL);
00271 
00272             long timediff = (end.tv_sec-start.tv_sec)*1000000l + (end.tv_usec-start.tv_usec);
00273             if(2000l*timeout < timediff) {
00274                 printf("timed out\n");
00275                 break;
00276             }
00277             if(-1 != nbytes) {
00278                 readcount2 += nbytes;
00279             }
00280         }
00281         // printf("\n\"%s\"\n", elm_response2);
00282         if(NULL != strstr(elm_response2, "ELM")) {
00283             write(fd, OBDCMD_NEWLINE, strlen(OBDCMD_NEWLINE));
00284             printf("success, ");
00285             return 0;
00286         } else {
00287             printf("fail [no ELM], ");
00288             modifybaud(fd,previousrate);
00289             return -1;
00290         }
00291     } else {
00292         printf("fail [no OK], ");
00293         modifybaud(fd,previousrate);
00294         return -1;
00295     }
00296 }
00297 
00298 long upgradebaudrate(int fd, long baudrate_target, long current_baudrate) {
00299 // AT BRD is discussed on pages 9-10,48-49 of the ELM327 datasheet
00300 
00301     // Temporarily make sure this is nonblocking
00302     int old_flags = fcntl(fd, F_GETFL);
00303     if(-1 == fcntl(fd,F_SETFL,O_NONBLOCK)) {
00304         perror("fcntl");
00305     }
00306 
00307     // Try these speeds
00308     long speeds[] = { 38400, 57600, 115200, 230400, 460800, 500000, 576000 };
00309 
00310     int i;
00311 
00312     if(-1 == baudrate_target) {
00313         return 0;
00314     }
00315 
00316     long current_best = -1;
00317 
00318     printf("Baudrate upgrading: ");
00319     if(0 < baudrate_target) {
00320         int retval = (0==attempt_upgradebaudrate(fd, baudrate_target,current_baudrate)?baudrate_target:-1);
00321         fcntl(fd,F_SETFL,old_flags);
00322         printf("\n");
00323         return retval;
00324     }
00325 
00326     for(i=0; i<sizeof(speeds)/sizeof(speeds[0]); i++) {
00327         if(0 == attempt_upgradebaudrate(fd, speeds[i], current_best)) {
00328             current_best = speeds[i];
00329         }
00330     }
00331     
00332     printf("\n");
00333     fcntl(fd,F_SETFL,old_flags);
00334     return current_best;
00335 }
00336 
00337 long guessbaudrate(int fd) {
00338     const char testcmd[] = "0100\r\n";
00339     long guesses[] = { 9600, 38400, 115200, 57600, 2400, 1200 };
00340     int i;
00341 
00342     printf("Baudrate guessing: ");
00343 
00344     for(i=0; i<sizeof(guesses)/sizeof(guesses[0]); i++) {
00345         long guess = guesses[i];
00346 
00347         printf("%li, ", guess);
00348         if(-1 == modifybaud(fd, guess)) {
00349             fprintf(stderr, "Error setting baudrate %li\n", guess);
00350             return -1;
00351         }
00352 
00353         char retbuf[1024];
00354         memset(retbuf, '\0', sizeof(retbuf));
00355 
00356         int nbytes = write(fd, testcmd, sizeof(testcmd));
00357         if(-1 == nbytes) {
00358             perror("Error writing to serial port guessing baudrate");
00359             return -1;
00360         }
00361 
00362         sleep(1); // CHEESY
00363         nbytes = read(fd, retbuf, sizeof(retbuf));
00364         if(-1 == nbytes) {
00365             perror("Error reading from serial port guessing baudrate");
00366             return -1;
00367         }
00368         if(NULL != strstr(retbuf, ">")) {
00369             printf("success at %li\n", guess);
00370             return guess;
00371         }
00372     }
00373     fprintf(stderr, "Couldn't guess baudrate\n");
00374     return -1;
00375 }
00376 
00377 int modifybaud(int fd, long baudrate) {
00378     // printf("Baudrate: %i\n", (int)baudrate);
00379     if(baudrate == -1) return 0;
00380 
00381     if(baudrate == 0) {
00382         return guessbaudrate(fd)>0?0:1;
00383     }
00384 
00385     struct termios options;
00386     if(0 != tcgetattr(fd, &options)) {
00387         perror("tcgetattr");
00388         return -1;
00389     }
00390 
00391     speed_t speedreq = B38400;
00392 
00393     switch(baudrate) {
00394 #ifdef B4000000
00395         case 4000000:
00396             speedreq = B4000000;
00397             break;
00398 #endif //B4000000
00399 #ifdef B3500000
00400         case 3500000:
00401             speedreq = B3500000;
00402             break;
00403 #endif //B3500000
00404 #ifdef B3000000
00405         case 3000000:
00406             speedreq = B3000000;
00407             break;
00408 #endif //B3000000
00409 #ifdef B2500000
00410         case 2500000:
00411             speedreq = B2500000;
00412             break;
00413 #endif //B2500000
00414 #ifdef B2000000
00415         case 2000000:
00416             speedreq = B2000000;
00417             break;
00418 #endif //B2000000
00419 #ifdef B1500000
00420         case 1500000:
00421             speedreq = B1500000;
00422             break;
00423 #endif //B1500000
00424 #ifdef B1152000
00425         case 1152000:
00426             speedreq = B1152000;
00427             break;
00428 #endif //B1152000
00429 #ifdef B1000000
00430         case 1000000:
00431             speedreq = B1000000;
00432             break;
00433 #endif //B1000000
00434 #ifdef B9210600
00435         case 9210600:
00436             speedreq = B9210600;
00437             break;
00438 #endif //B9210600
00439 #ifdef B576000
00440         case 576000:
00441             speedreq = B576000;
00442             break;
00443 #endif //B576000
00444 #ifdef B500000
00445         case 500000:
00446             speedreq = B500000;
00447             break;
00448 #endif //B500000
00449 #ifdef B460800
00450         case 460800:
00451             speedreq = B460800;
00452             break;
00453 #endif //B460800
00454 #ifdef B230400
00455         case 230400:
00456             speedreq = B230400;
00457             break;
00458 #endif //B230400
00459 #ifdef B115200
00460         case 115200:
00461             speedreq = B115200;
00462             break;
00463 #endif //B115200
00464 #ifdef B76800
00465         case 76800:
00466             speedreq = B76800;
00467             break;
00468 #endif //B76800
00469 #ifdef B57600
00470         case 57600:
00471             speedreq = B57600;
00472             break;
00473 #endif //B57600
00474         case 38400:
00475             speedreq = B38400;
00476             break;
00477 #ifdef B28800
00478         case 28800:
00479             speedreq = B28800;
00480             break;
00481 #endif //B28800
00482         case 19200:
00483             speedreq = B19200;
00484             break;
00485 #ifdef B14400
00486         case 14400:
00487             speedreq = B14400;
00488             break;
00489 #endif //B14400
00490         case 9600:
00491             speedreq = B9600;
00492             break;
00493 #ifdef B7200
00494         case 7200:
00495             speedreq = B7200;
00496             break;
00497 #endif //B7200
00498         case 4800:
00499             speedreq = B4800;
00500             break;
00501         case 2400:
00502             speedreq = B2400;
00503             break;
00504         case 1200:
00505             speedreq = B1200;
00506             break;
00507         case 600:
00508             speedreq = B600;
00509             break;
00510         case 300:
00511             speedreq = B300;
00512             break;
00513         case 150:
00514             speedreq = B150;
00515             break;
00516         case 134:
00517             speedreq = B134;
00518             break;
00519         case 110:
00520             speedreq = B110;
00521             break;
00522         case 75:
00523             speedreq = B75;
00524             break;
00525         case 50:
00526             speedreq = B50;
00527             break;
00528         case 0: // Don't look at me like *I* think it's a good idea
00529             speedreq = B0;
00530             break;
00531         default:
00532             fprintf(stderr,"Uknown baudrate: %li\n", baudrate);
00533             return -1;
00534             break;
00535 
00536     }
00537 
00538     if(0 != cfsetispeed(&options, speedreq)) {
00539         perror("cfsetispeed");
00540         return -1;
00541     }
00542 
00543     if(0 != cfsetospeed(&options, speedreq)) {
00544         perror("cfsetospeed");
00545         return -1;
00546     }
00547 
00548     if(0 != tcsetattr(fd, TCSANOW, &options)) {
00549         perror("tcsetattr");
00550         return -1;
00551     }
00552 
00553     return 0;
00554 }
00555 
00556 int startseriallog(const char *logname) {
00557     if(NULL == (seriallog = fopen(logname, "w"))) {
00558         perror("Couldn't open seriallog");
00559         return 1;
00560     }
00561     return 0;
00562 }
00563 
00564 void closeseriallog() {
00565     fflush(seriallog);
00566     fclose(seriallog);
00567     seriallog = NULL;
00568 }
00569 
00570 enum obd_serial_status getobderrorcodes(int fd,
00571     unsigned int *retvals, unsigned int retvals_size, int *numbytes_returned) {
00572 
00573     enum obd_serial_status ret;
00574     // First, find out how many codes are set
00575     unsigned int codecount[4];
00576     int c;
00577     if(OBD_SUCCESS != (ret = getobdbytes(fd, 0x01, 0x01, 0,
00578         codecount, sizeof(codecount)/sizeof(codecount[0]), &c, 0))) {
00579 
00580         return ret;
00581     }
00582 
00583     // This bit being set means the MIL is on, doesn't contribute to error count
00584     unsigned int mil_mask = 0x80;
00585     // Actual count of errors
00586     int numtroubles = codecount[0] & (~mil_mask);
00587 
00588     printf("%i trouble codes set [MIL is %s]\n", numtroubles,
00589         (codecount[0] & mil_mask)?"on":"off");
00590 
00591     if(0 == numtroubles) {
00592         *numbytes_returned = 0;
00593         return OBD_SUCCESS;
00594     }
00595 
00596     return getobdbytes(fd, 0x03, 0x00, 0, retvals, retvals_size, numbytes_returned, 0);
00597 }
00598 
00599 
00600 /// Parse a line from obd
00601 static enum obd_serial_status parseobdline(const char *line, unsigned int mode, unsigned int cmd,
00602     unsigned int *retvals, unsigned int retvals_size, unsigned int *vals_read, int quiet) {
00603 
00604     unsigned int response; // Response. Should always be 0x40 + mode
00605     unsigned int cmdret; // Mode returned [should be the same as cmd]
00606 
00607     int count; // number of retvals successfully sscanf'd
00608 
00609     unsigned int currbytes[20]; // Might be a long line if there's a bunch of errors
00610 
00611     int have_cmd; // Set if we expect a cmd thing returned
00612     if(0x03 == mode || 0x04 == mode) {
00613         // Don't look for the second "cmd" item in some modes.
00614         have_cmd = 0;
00615     } else {
00616         have_cmd = 1;
00617     }
00618 
00619     // Number of items to subtract from count to figure out
00620     //   how many items in curr_bytes we found
00621     int count_sub;
00622     if(have_cmd) {
00623         count_sub = 2;
00624         count = sscanf(line,
00625             "%2x %2x "
00626             "%2x %2x %2x %2x %2x %2x %2x %2x %2x %2x "
00627             "%2x %2x %2x %2x %2x %2x %2x %2x %2x %2x",
00628             &response, &cmdret,
00629             currbytes, currbytes+1, currbytes+2, currbytes+3, currbytes+4,
00630             currbytes+5, currbytes+6, currbytes+7, currbytes+8, currbytes+9,
00631             currbytes+10, currbytes+11, currbytes+12, currbytes+13, currbytes+14,
00632             currbytes+15, currbytes+16, currbytes+17, currbytes+18, currbytes+19
00633             );
00634     } else {
00635         count_sub = 1;
00636         count = sscanf(line,
00637             "%2x "
00638             "%2x %2x %2x %2x %2x %2x %2x %2x %2x %2x "
00639             "%2x %2x %2x %2x %2x %2x %2x %2x %2x %2x",
00640             &response,
00641             currbytes, currbytes+1, currbytes+2, currbytes+3, currbytes+4,
00642             currbytes+5, currbytes+6, currbytes+7, currbytes+8, currbytes+9,
00643             currbytes+10, currbytes+11, currbytes+12, currbytes+13, currbytes+14,
00644             currbytes+15, currbytes+16, currbytes+17, currbytes+18, currbytes+19
00645             );
00646     }
00647 
00648     if(count <= 2) {
00649         if(!quiet)
00650             fprintf(stderr, "Couldn't parse line for %02X %02X: %s\n", mode, cmd, line);
00651         return OBD_UNPARSABLE;
00652     }
00653 
00654     if(response != 0x40 + mode) {
00655         if(!quiet)
00656             fprintf(stderr, "Unsuccessful mode response for %02X %02X: %s\n", mode, cmd, line);
00657         return OBD_INVALID_RESPONSE;
00658     }
00659 
00660     if(have_cmd && cmdret != cmd) {
00661         if(!quiet)
00662             fprintf(stderr, "Unsuccessful cmd response for %02X %02X: %s\n", mode, cmd, line);
00663         return OBD_INVALID_MODE;
00664     }
00665 
00666     int i;
00667     for(i=0;i<count-count_sub && i<retvals_size;i++) {
00668         retvals[i] = currbytes[i];
00669     }
00670 
00671     *vals_read = count-count_sub;
00672 
00673     return OBD_SUCCESS;
00674 }
00675 
00676 
00677 enum obd_serial_status getobdbytes(int fd, unsigned int mode, unsigned int cmd, int numbytes_expected,
00678     unsigned int *retvals, unsigned int retvals_size, int *numbytes_returned, int quiet) {
00679 
00680     char sendbuf[20]; // Command to send
00681     int sendbuflen; // Number of bytes in the send buffer
00682 
00683     char retbuf[4096]; // Buffer to store returned stuff
00684 
00685     int nbytes; // Number of bytes read
00686 
00687     if(mode == 0x03 || mode == 0x04) {
00688         sendbuflen = snprintf(sendbuf,sizeof(sendbuf),"%02X" OBDCMD_NEWLINE, mode);
00689     } else {
00690         if(0 == numbytes_expected) {
00691             sendbuflen = snprintf(sendbuf,sizeof(sendbuf),"%02X%02X" OBDCMD_NEWLINE, mode, cmd);
00692         } else {
00693             sendbuflen = snprintf(sendbuf,sizeof(sendbuf),"%02X%02X%01X" OBDCMD_NEWLINE, mode, cmd, numbytes_expected);
00694         }
00695     }
00696 
00697     appendseriallog(sendbuf, SERIAL_OUT);
00698     if(write(fd,sendbuf,sendbuflen) < sendbuflen) {
00699         return OBD_ERROR;
00700     }
00701 
00702     nbytes = readserialdata(fd, retbuf, sizeof(retbuf));
00703     if(0 == nbytes) {
00704         if(!quiet)
00705             fprintf(stderr, "No data at all returned from serial port\n");
00706         return OBD_ERROR;
00707     } else if(-1 == nbytes) {
00708         if(!quiet)
00709             fprintf(stderr, "Error reading from serial port\n");
00710         return OBD_ERROR;
00711     }
00712 
00713     // First some sanity checks on the data
00714 
00715     if(NULL != strstr(retbuf, "NO DATA")) {
00716         if(!quiet)
00717             fprintf(stderr, "OBD reported NO DATA for %02X %02X: %s\n", mode, cmd, retbuf);
00718         return OBD_NO_DATA;
00719     }
00720 
00721     if(0 != strstr(retbuf, "?")) {
00722         if(!quiet)
00723             fprintf(stderr, "OBD reported ? for %02X %02X: %s\n", mode, cmd, retbuf);
00724         return OBD_NO_DATA;
00725     }
00726 
00727     if(NULL != strstr(retbuf, "UNABLE TO CONNECT")) {
00728         if(!quiet)
00729             fprintf(stderr, "OBD reported UNABLE TO CONNECT for %02X %02X: %s\n", mode, cmd, retbuf);
00730         return OBD_UNABLE_TO_CONNECT;
00731     }
00732 
00733     /* 
00734         Good grief, this is ugly.
00735         1) We look go through the output line by line [strtokking]
00736         2) For each line, if it's a regular line, parse it
00737         3) If it has a colon near the start, it means it's a multi-line response
00738         4) So go into crazy C string handling mode.
00739     */
00740 
00741     char *line = strtok(retbuf, "\r\n>");
00742 
00743     int values_returned = 0;
00744     enum obd_serial_status ret = OBD_ERROR;
00745     while(NULL != line) {
00746         char *colon;
00747         int joined_lines = 0; // Set if we joined some lines together
00748         char longline[1024] = "\0"; // Catenate other lines into this
00749 
00750         char *parseline = line; // The line to actually parse.
00751 
00752         while(NULL != line && NULL != (colon = strstr(line, ":"))) {
00753             // printf("Colon line: %s\n", line);
00754             strncat(longline, colon+1, sizeof(longline)-strlen(longline)-1);
00755             parseline = longline;
00756             joined_lines = 1;
00757             line = strtok(NULL, "\r\n>");
00758         }
00759         // We gracefully handle these lines without
00760         //   needing to actually parse them
00761         if(3 >= strlen(parseline)) continue;
00762 
00763         // printf("parseline: %s\n", parseline);
00764 
00765         unsigned int local_rets[20];
00766         unsigned int vals_read;
00767 
00768         ret = parseobdline(parseline, mode, cmd,
00769             local_rets, sizeof(local_rets)/sizeof(local_rets[0]), &vals_read, quiet);
00770 
00771         if(OBD_SUCCESS == ret) {
00772             int i;
00773             for(i=0; i<vals_read; i++, values_returned++) {
00774                 retvals[values_returned] = local_rets[i];
00775             }
00776             break;
00777         }
00778 
00779         if(0 == joined_lines) {
00780             // If we joined some lines together, this strtok was already done
00781             line = strtok(NULL, "\r\n>");
00782         }
00783     }
00784     *numbytes_returned = values_returned;
00785     if(0 == values_returned) return ret;
00786     return OBD_SUCCESS;
00787 }
00788 
00789 enum obd_serial_status getobdvalue(int fd, unsigned int cmd, float *ret, int numbytes, OBDConvFunc conv) {
00790     int numbytes_returned;
00791     unsigned int obdbytes[4];
00792 
00793     enum obd_serial_status ret_status = getobdbytes(fd, 0x01, cmd, numbytes,
00794         obdbytes, sizeof(obdbytes)/sizeof(obdbytes[0]), &numbytes_returned, 0);
00795 
00796     if(OBD_SUCCESS != ret_status) return ret_status;
00797 
00798     if(NULL == conv) {
00799         int i;
00800         *ret = 0;
00801         for(i=0;i<numbytes_returned;i++) {
00802             *ret = *ret * 256;
00803             *ret = *ret + obdbytes[i];
00804         }
00805     } else {
00806         *ret = conv(obdbytes[0], obdbytes[1], obdbytes[2], obdbytes[3]);
00807     }
00808     return OBD_SUCCESS;
00809 }
00810 
00811 int getnumobderrors(int fd) {
00812     int numbytes_returned;
00813     unsigned int obdbytes[4];
00814     
00815     enum obd_serial_status ret_status = getobdbytes(fd, 0x01, 0x01, 0,
00816         obdbytes, sizeof(obdbytes)/sizeof(obdbytes[0]), &numbytes_returned, 0);
00817     
00818     if(OBD_SUCCESS != ret_status || 0 == numbytes_returned) return 0;
00819     
00820     if(obdbytes[0] > 0) {
00821         return obdbytes[0] & 0x7F;
00822     }
00823     
00824     return 0;
00825 }
